video.title: Low-Code for Freelance Developers & Startups – Tutorial
video.description:
Low-code is a software development approach that requires little coding in order to build applications. It is made possible through a low-code platform. Learn how to use low code tools and APIs to build a customer support dashboard. You will learn how create the dashboard using the Appsmith platform, Google Sheet API, and the Stripe API.

✏️ Ania Kubów created this course. Check out her channel: https://www.youtube.com/aniakubow

🏗️ This course was made possible through a grant from Appsmith. Learn more about Appsmith: https://www.appsmith.com/

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Code with Ania Kubów
topLevelComment.text: Hope everyone enjoys this video! As always thank you to everyone watching for their continuous support of our mission to provide free learning resources for people all over the world!

topLevelComment.author: DC
topLevelComment.text:
Very much appreciate the tutorial. Just happened to find a few things that could be of major issue.

Regarding the orders table:
If you filter or use the search bar, it changes the index of each order, which if you then delete an order, it may delete an incorrect order.
When deleting the order, it doesnt delete the products associated to that order.
I think it needs to delete (for both the order and products sheet), rows based on the selected order id. Trying to figure this out myself now. Ill update when i can.

This isnt meant to be criticism, just if anyone was to genuinely use this, it could be bad. But even no/low code isnt bug free

replies.author: Bahadir Ozkurt
replies.text:
That's not a bug, but an oversight perhaps. No one should be using a tutorials exact steps in a production environment anyway :)
As long as one takes care to details, like you did in your comment, all will work well

topLevelComment.author: DmitryDaren
topLevelComment.text: another weird thing... when the page loads (both build and deployed view) the row 0 is selected, ok, but the query showing the product doesn’t run itself... have to click on the 0 row....

replies.author: DmitryDaren
replies.text:
@DC have not tried, but how can it help? the problem is that the products query, although set to run at page load, does not run (or anyhow it’s result is empty when page loads) and the products don’t display in the List, until the user clicks anywhere in the table. 
Fix I found: can create Js script and set it to  run at page load, and run the query (may be once again?) from there..

replies.author: DC
replies.text: you can just remove '0' from the Default Selected Row. i know that doesnt really 'fix' it but hopefully it helps

topLevelComment.author: DmitryDaren
topLevelComment.text:
Hi again, the query to get the products by the order Id did not work for me for some reason when the Id is alphanumeric , like yours,  until I made it numeric... 
generally this feels quite a bit glitchy... don’t you think so ?

replies.author: James Wang
replies.text: I tried numeric but had no luck, error message is "Invalid entry at index:0. Missing required key:lable“. There is another glitch at Status JS of Text Color, error message is ”currentRow is undefined“.

replies.author: Phúc Nguyễn (Incarnat1on)
replies.text:
@Creator's Remorse Sorry to interrupt, but do you have some sort of glowing orb under your basement, then why are you so sure with "Obviously, that never happened"? And also, what's the point of the comment, may I ask? 
Technology is pretty unpredictable - I truly agree, and I clearly know that's why you said so. 
However, I've seen this being mentioned a lot as a way of rapidly deploying applications, it's going to have its own space for specific scenarios.
There are billions of people in the world, and scenarios/decisions where this should be a feasible way instead of traditionally coding an application. 
It never happened to you, doesn't necessarily mean that it's the same for another people.
